text: Hey <@U25PYL3Q8> how are you ? Happy new year :slightly_smiling_face: I want to get this RSS feed <https://www.degroupnews.com/rss> in a custom module to create my own html structure.

Hello Dev team :slightly_smiling_face:

I have a blog list with more than 6 000 posts. On the default list it's OK because I have the possibility to use pagination or infinte scroll.

But on the archive page all blog posts are loaded. It's too much !
So I would like to paginate the archive page (/all)
Does anyone have an idea how to recreate the pagination on /all page ?
Happy new year! Have you tried doing a ajax call to it to get the data?
<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/33212922/parsing-xml-rss-feed-using-jquery-and-ajax>
using <http://cors.io|cors.io> should help that issue with the CORS issue, if that is the issue you are having
I will try the first option and then the second and tell you. Thanks for your help :slightly_smiling_face:

First attempt : Access to XMLHttpRequest at '<https://www.degroupnews.com/rss>' from origin '<https://blog.ariase.com>' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.
lol
for the url are you doing <http://cors.io/?u=https://www.degroupnews.com/rss.xml>
yes

Access to XMLHttpRequest at '<http://cors.io/?u=https://www.degroupnews.com/rss.xml>' from origin '<https://blog.ariase.com>' has been blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header is present on the requested resource.
same issue CORS pb ;(
do you have access to the htaccess file on the <http://degroupnews.com|degroupnews.com> site?
it's possible
okay I have something to add to the htaccess to allow it
give me like 20 minutes
no pb
I use this on any wordpress site
Allow origin is going to be your HubSpot site
For some reason the link keeps getting removed
lol Looks like it kept placing it in here hahaha

This is the markup I used to pull the first bit of the blog post to be used in a "read more" type scenario.. can I do the same exact thing but pull from the pages meta desc, rather than the post body? Thanks!!

^ alternatively, is there a way to force character styles on that? It is picking up bold text from the text editor which makes my post-listing page look a little messy. My class "u-small-text" is being ignored.
Thanks
You can use the `striptags` filter to remove any HTML tags
`|striptags`
Thanks!
